summary: Jim Spencer has helped lead several start-up and established Internet and mobile content companies. In 2008, Jim founded Newsy, (Newsy.com) an early mobile, OTTV and online video news service that was acquired by the E.W. Scripps Company in 2014. Jim was VP of Content at Ask Jeeves (Ask.com) where he was responsible for all search queries and helped guide the company to the be the 15th most trafficked website and through a successful IPO. Prior to Ask Jeeves, Jim was the GM of News and Information Programming at AOL (Aol.com - news, sports, health, research and international) - advancing the content, business and partnership operations for one of AOL’s major business units. Jim has also served as executive director of partnerships for NBC based at NBC’s NYC headquarters and Microsoft’s Redmond campus (MSNBC.com) and as the GM of new media at Multimedia, Inc. prior to its sale to Gannett. Jim has a bachelor’s degree in film from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and a master’s degree from the Missouri School of Journalism.
